00020 const ConstMap<std::string,int> CapProp = ConstMap<std::string,int>
00021     ("PosMsec",CV_CAP_PROP_POS_MSEC)  // Current position of the video file in milliseconds or video capture timestamp.
00022     ("PosFrames",CV_CAP_PROP_POS_FRAMES)  // 0-based index of the frame to be decoded/captured next.
00023     ("AVIRatio",CV_CAP_PROP_POS_AVI_RATIO)  // Relative position of the video file: 0 - start of the film, 1 - end of the film.
00024     ("FrameWidth",CV_CAP_PROP_FRAME_WIDTH)  // Width of the frames in the video stream.
00025     ("FrameHeight",CV_CAP_PROP_FRAME_HEIGHT)  // Height of the frames in the video stream.
00026     ("FPS",CV_CAP_PROP_FPS)  // Frame rate.
00027     ("FourCC",CV_CAP_PROP_FOURCC)  // 4-character code of codec.
00028     ("FrameCount",CV_CAP_PROP_FRAME_COUNT)  // Number of frames in the video file.
00029     ("Format",CV_CAP_PROP_FORMAT)  // Format of the Mat objects returned by retrieve() .
00030     ("Mode",CV_CAP_PROP_MODE)  // Backend-specific value indicating the current capture mode.
00031     ("Brightness",CV_CAP_PROP_BRIGHTNESS)  // Brightness of the image (only for cameras).
00032     ("Contrast",CV_CAP_PROP_CONTRAST)  // Contrast of the image (only for cameras).
00033     ("Saturation",CV_CAP_PROP_SATURATION)  // Saturation of the image (only for cameras).
00034     ("Hue",CV_CAP_PROP_HUE)  // Hue of the image (only for cameras).
00035     ("Gain",CV_CAP_PROP_GAIN)  // Gain of the image (only for cameras).
00036     ("Exposure",CV_CAP_PROP_EXPOSURE)  // Exposure (only for cameras).
00037     ("ConvertRGB",CV_CAP_PROP_CONVERT_RGB)  // Boolean flags indicating whether images should be converted to RGB.
00038     //("WhiteBalance",CV_CAP_PROP_WHITE_BALANCE)  // Currently not supported
00039     ("Rectification",CV_CAP_PROP_RECTIFICATION)  // Rectification flag for stereo cameras (note: only supported by DC1394 v 2.x backend currently)

00041 
00049 void mexFunction( int nlhs, mxArray *plhs[],
00050                   int nrhs, const mxArray *prhs[] )
00051 {
00052     if (nrhs<1 || nlhs>1)
00053         mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Wrong number of arguments");
00054     
00055     // Determine argument format between constructor or (id,method,...)
00056     vector<MxArray> rhs(prhs,prhs+nrhs);
00057     int id = 0;
00058     string method;
00059     if (nrhs==1) {
00060         // Constructor is called. Create a new object from argument
00061         obj_[++last_id] = (rhs[0].isChar()) ? 
00062             VideoCapture(rhs[0].toString()) : VideoCapture(rhs[0].toInt());
00063         plhs[0] = MxArray(last_id);
00064         return;
00065     }
00066     else if (rhs[0].isNumeric() && rhs[0].numel()==1 && nrhs>1) {
00067         id = rhs[0].toInt();
00068         method = rhs[1].toString();
00069     }
00070     else
00071         mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Invalid arguments");
00072     
00073     // Big operation switch
00074     VideoCapture& obj = obj_[id];
00075     if (method == "delete") {
00076         if (nrhs!=2 || nlhs!=0)
00077             mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Output not assigned");
00078         obj_.erase(id);
00079     }
00080     else if (method == "open") {
00081         if (nrhs!=3)
00082             mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Wrong number of arguments");
00083         bool b = (rhs[2].isChar()) ?
00084             obj.open(rhs[2].toString()) : obj.open(rhs[2].toInt());
00085         plhs[0] = MxArray(b);
00086     }
00087     else if (method == "isOpened") {
00088         if (nrhs!=2)
00089             mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Wrong number of arguments");
00090         plhs[0] = MxArray(obj.isOpened());
00091     }
00092     else if (method == "release") {
00093         if (nrhs!=2 || nlhs!=0)
00094             mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Output not assigned");
00095         obj.release();
00096     }
00097     else if (method == "grab") {
00098         if (nrhs!=2)
00099             mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Wrong number of arguments");
00100         plhs[0] = MxArray(obj.grab());
00101     }
00102     else if (method == "retrieve") {
00103         if (nrhs!=2)
00104             mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Wrong number of arguments");
00105         Mat frame;
00106         if (obj.retrieve(frame)) {
00107             if (frame.type()==CV_8UC3)
00108                 cvtColor(frame,frame,CV_BGR2RGB);
00109             plhs[0] = MxArray(frame);
00110         }
00111         else
00112             plhs[0] = MxArray(mxCreateNumericMatrix(0,0,mxUINT8_CLASS,mxREAL));
00113     }
00114     else if (method == "read") {
00115         if (nrhs!=2)
00116             mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Wrong number of arguments");
00117         Mat frame;
00118         if (obj.read(frame)) {
00119             if (frame.type()==CV_8UC3)
00120                 cvtColor(frame,frame,CV_BGR2RGB);
00121             plhs[0] = MxArray(frame);
00122         }
00123         else
00124             plhs[0] = MxArray(mxCreateNumericMatrix(0,0,mxUINT8_CLASS,mxREAL));
00125     }
00126     else if (method == "get") {
00127         if (nrhs!=3)
00128             mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Wrong number of arguments");
00129         plhs[0] = MxArray(obj.get(CapProp[rhs[2].toString()]));
00130     }
00131     else if (method == "set") {
00132         if (nrhs!=4)
00133             mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Wrong number of arguments");
00134         plhs[0] = MxArray(obj.set(CapProp[rhs[2].toString()],rhs[3].toDouble()));
00135     }
00136     else
00137         mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Unrecognized operation");
00138 }
